instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-3435 backlight fuse
threads.message:
820-3435 with no backlight. Original damage is severe burn where backlight fuse goes. Replaced backlight fuse and have fused soldered directly to pin 4 of Q7706 and wire running to R7006 for PPBUS_G3H however every time the backlight starts to activate the wire just burns and separates.

What else should I try?

threads.title: 820-3435 backlight fuse
threads.message:
You should check if any short persists on the board, BEFORE applying power.
Check w/ and w/o LCD connected.

threads.title: 820-3435 backlight fuse
threads.message:
without wire there is no short w/wo lcd but with new wire ran there is a 0.54 short on F7700 w/o lcd and w lcd 0.38

how do you solve something like this besides just scraping away at affected area more?

threads.title: 820-3435 backlight fuse
threads.message:
Do you mean 0.38-0.54 on diode mode?
That is no short at all.
I expected you will check on pins 3/4 of J8300, not only F7700.

threads.title: 820-3435 backlight fuse
threads.message: Yes readings on pins 3/4 is .572 but jumper wire still burns each time the backlight starts to activate

threads.title: 820-3435 backlight fuse
threads.message:
Did you check on the jumper wire too?
No short or low value?
Pad 2 of F7700 can be damaged and shorted to second copper layer, which is ground.
If is the case, isolate pad 2 and wire pad1 to pin 4 of Q7706.
Be sure R7788 makes contact too.
Also check no short remains on the board, before apply power; especially Q7706 pins.

threads.title: 820-3435 backlight fuse
threads.message:
With a wire on F7700 going to pin 4 of Q7706 and pad 1 of F770 being isolate (no wire to PPBUS_G3H) there is no short 0.806 on diode mode but still smokes when power is applied with or without lcd.

picture attached of damaged area

threads.title: 820-3435 backlight fuse
threads.message: Smoke comes from a component or board itself?

threads.title: 820-3435 backlight fuse
threads.message:
Scratch inside the board in that place.
Make a hole in the surface (first layers), and polish the edge.
